title: Edinson Cavani and Thiago Silva 'set to leave PSG for free' at the end of the season
text:
PSG club legends Edinson Cavani and Thiago Silva are set to leave the club for free at the end of the season.

With both the striker, 32, and centre-back, 35, in the final year of their contracts, the French champions have not offered either a new deal.

According to ESPN, Cavani holds out some hope that he can earn another short term deal but Silva has not been consulted.

Edinson Cavani is in the final year of his PSG contract and is set to leave for free

The Uruguayan still believes he can mix it among Europe's elite and would ideally like to stay on the continent if he leaves.

Atletico Madrid, Napoli, Manchester United and Inter Milan are all understood to be long-term admirers of the prolific forward.

PSG have made new contracts for Marquinhos Marco Verratti a priority at present.

Mauro Icardi is looking to impress to the extent that PSG opt to make his move from Inter a permanent one, another factor counting against Cavani.

Thiago Silva, 35, has been at the club for seven seasons and his time is coming to an end

He has also struggled with persistent injury problems in recent months which may put the French side off renewing his contract.

The MLS is another possible destination for Cavani although there are not thought to be offers on the table as it stands.

Cavani has been at the club for six years and scored more than 100 goals while Silva has put in seven years of service.

Both will be remembered with great affection at the Parc des Princes if this is to be their final season.
description: PSG club legends Edinson Cavani and Thiago Silva are set to leave the club for free at the end of the season. Both the striker, 32, and centre-back, 35, in the final year of their contracts.
